29328.name: Credit
29328.desc: This currency, used by the Interastral Peace Corporation to settle accounts with its customers, is now widely accepted as the hard currency for space travel.
29328.lore: "People run around fighting and trading for numbers in a terminal, but the truly precious cannot be bought."

125435.name: Tracks of Destiny
125435.lore: Your victory is secured by countless failures, and the small steps you have taken led you to the turning point of fate.

409960.name: Traveler's Guide
409960.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>20,000</nobr> Character EXP.
409960.lore:
Required reading for world exploration. Press the "Read" button to tune in to an attractive voice in a language you understand, telling you about the legendary encounters of renowned adventurers across different worlds as well as the precious wisdom and knowledge that they have gathered.

"All-new series of the Traveler's Guide, The Chef's Manual to Galactic Cuisine, is now available for purchase."
"For submissions, please connect to synesthesia beacon ERD-23θ to contact an Intelligentsia Guild representative. Method of payment can be arranged to your convenience."

409961.name: Adventure Log
409961.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>5000</nobr> Character EXP.
409961.lore:
A neatly organized collection of educational adventure notes containing countless illustrations and texts entailing adventures from beginning to end, as well as valuable information and survival-related techniques.

"Why not just digitize it and save it on a photolith disk? That'd be much more convenient."
"Advanced technology is far more fragile than you'd think when faced with stellar storms and neuron flow eruptions. Besides, I'm sure the author of this book wanted people to read it in the simplest of ways."

409962.name: Travel Encounters
409962.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>1000</nobr> Character EXP.
409962.lore:
A travel diary with messy handwriting and random content. It's not of much use to you.

"Dan Heng, hurry up and finish reading it so you can throw it away."

468392.name: Suppressing Edict
468392.desc: Parts used in the Xianzhou ingenium technology. Can be used for the Ascension of Imaginary characters.
468392.lore:
After Rubert unleashed the calamity of inorganic life, the aurumaton in Xianzhou also rebelled and began a ruthless slaughter. To ensure that the turmoil does not resurface, the craftsmen imposed imprisonment using talismans, stripping the aurumaton of their ability to think.

"What on earth did you do to make this fellow go mad?"
"I didn't do anything! I just... cleaned that golden talisman a bit."

470781.name: Past Evils of the Borehole Planet Disaster
470781.lore:
As a descendant bred personally by the Imperator Insectorum, its only desire is to expand the numbers of its kind. It uses giant scythes to harvest planets for its nest, tirelessly nurturing countless offspring, and devastating innumerable lives until the moment of its death.

"On the broken planet, giant locusts blotted out the sky, and swarms of insects poured out of the planet's crust. The stag beetle raised this new nest and presented it as a gift to its Imperator Insectorum... May this horror only exist in historical records, never to appear again."

549210.name: Tatters of Thought
549210.desc: A memoria fragment of fleeting thought. Crude material used for enhancement.
549210.lore:
Within the Memory Zone, thousands of thoughts flutter like dust. Broken thoughts accumulate, serving as nourishment and components for memes.

"A fleeting thought may dissipate into thin air or amass into obsessions."
comeFrom: Dropped by enemies in Divergent Universe

589817.name: Crystal Meteorites
589817.desc: The crystals that separate from the Amber Lord's body when THEY swing the celestial hammer. Used to level up Traces moderately for Preservation characters.
589817.lore:
People only become aware of the fact that Qlipoth has swung THEIR hammer again from the two phenomena invariably detected afterward: An enormous burst of intense gravitational waves, and "starquakes." Like a gift from the Preservation, the crystal meteorites dash across the dark sky and announce the beginning of a new Era.

"The Genius Society is audacious enough to declare the Amber Lord as the slowest Aeon in the Cosmos, but none of these people have ever successfully observed the entire process of Qlipoth swinging the celestial hammer."

633151.name: Fragments of Impression
633151.desc: A memoria fragment of profound impression. Normal material used for enhancement.
633151.lore:
Within the Memory Zone, the form of memories float as fleeting glimmers of light, and only profound and memorable fragments can condense it crystals.

"Memory is not a mere replication of past sensations, but a reconstruction of past impressions."
comeFrom: Memory Zone Meme at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher
Dropped by enemies in Divergent Universe

673758.name: Divine Amber
673758.desc: The amber that rains from the Amber Lord's body when THEY swing the celestial hammer. Used to level up Traces significantly for Preservation characters.
673758.lore:
Although Pier Point sent out Meteor Hunters and intercepted most of the meteors, the brightest one among all these shooting stars will always only be seen by the chosen one.

"It is a part of the divine body of the Aeon, albeit an insignificant one. Only the chosen ones, with their minds as steadfast as cornerstones and having endured challenges and hardships, can chisel apart this amber and unleash the crystalized light within."

717092.name: Shards of Desires
717092.desc: A memoria fragment of obsessive desires. Advanced material used for enhancement.
717092.lore:
Within the Memory Zone, memoria of desires develops ceaselessly. It absorbs thoughts and impressions, nurtures magic mirrors of desires, and reflects the eerie shadows of memetic entities.

"Memory points to the past, while desire points to the future. To seek desires from memory will cause dreams to become inverted, and inner demons will naturally be born."
comeFrom: Memory Zone Meme at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher
Dropped by enemies in Divergent Universe

874344.name: Scattered Stardust
874344.desc: The dust that falls from the Amber Lord's body when they swing the divine hammer. Used to level up Traces slightly for Preservation characters.
874344.lore:
The guards at Pier Point have never left their posts on Qlipoth's orbit, simply waiting for a miracle that only occurs once in decades or even centuries — How stardust splutters up like countless raindrops the moment the giant hammer falls.

"The stardust are simply insignificant dust to the Amber Lord, but to us, every speck of it contains the essence of Preservation."

ranks.name: Prisoner's Dilemma
ranks.descHash: Increases CRIT DMG by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> for allies with Fortified Wager. After using the Ultimate, provides all allies with a Fortified Wager shield, whose Shield effect is equal to <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr> of the one provided by the Skill, lasting for <nobr>#3[i]</nobr> turn(s).

ranks.name: Bounded Rationality
ranks.descHash: When using the Basic ATK, reduces the target's All-Type RES by <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr> for <nobr>#3[i]</nobr> turn(s).

ranks.name: Droprate Maxing
ranks.descHash:
Ultimate Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Basic ATK Lv. +1, up to a maximum of Lv. 10.

ranks.name: Unexpected Hanging Paradox
ranks.descHash: When triggering his Talent's follow-up attack, first increases Aventurine's DEF by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> for <nobr>#2[i]</nobr> turn(s), and additionally increases the Hits Per Action for his talent's follow-up attack by <nobr>#3[i]</nobr>.

ranks.name: Ambiguity Aversion
ranks.descHash:
Skill Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Talent Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.

ranks.name: Stag Hunt Game
ranks.descHash: For every ally that holds a Shield, the DMG dealt by Aventurine increases by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>, up to a maximum of <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr>.

skills.descHash: Deals Imaginary DMG equal to #1[i]% of Aventurine's DEF to a single target enemy.
skills.name: Straight Bet

skills.descHash: Provides all allies with a Fortified Wager shield that can block DMG equal to #1[f1]% of Aventurine's DEF plus #2[i], lasting for #3[i] turn(s). When Fortified Wager is gained repeatedly, the Shield effect can stack, up to #4[i]% of the current Shield effect provided by the Skill.
skills.name: Cornerstone Deluxe

skills.descHash: Randomly gains 1 to #1[i] points of Blind Bet. Then, inflicts Unnerved on a single target enemy for #4[i] turn(s) and deals Imaginary DMG equal to #2[i]% of Aventurine's DEF to the single target enemy. When an ally hits an Unnerved enemy target, the CRIT DMG dealt increases by #3[f1]%.
skills.name: Roulette Shark

skills.descHash: For any single ally with Fortified Wager, their Effect RES increases by #4[f1]%, and when they get attacked, Aventurine gains 1 point of Blind Bet. When Aventurine has Fortified Wager, he can resist Crowd Control debuffs. This effect can trigger again after #5[i] turn(s). Aventurine additionally gains #1[i] point(s) of Blind Bet after getting attacked. Upon reaching 7 points of Blind Bet, Aventurine consumes the 7 points to launch a #2[i]-hit follow-up attack, with each hit dealing Imaginary DMG equal to #3[i]% of Aventurine's DEF to a single random enemy. Blind Bet is capped at 10 points.
skills.name: Shot Loaded Right

skills.descHash: Attacks an enemy, and when the battle starts, reduces their Toughness of the corresponding Type.
skills.name: Attack

skills.descHash:
After using the Technique, 1 of the following effects will be granted:
There is a chance for DEF to increase by #1[i]%.
There is a high chance for DEF to increase by #2[i]%.
There is a small chance for DEF to increase by #3[i]%.

When this Technique is used repeatedly, the acquired effect with the highest buff value is retained.
When the next battle starts, increases all allies' DEF by the corresponding value, lasting for #4[i] turn(s).
skills.name: The Red or the Black

embedBonusSkill.descHash: After an ally with Fortified Wager launches a follow-up attack, Aventurine accumulates 1 Blind Bet point. This effect can trigger up to <nobr>#3[i]</nobr> time(s). Its trigger count resets at the start of Aventurine's turn. After Aventurine launches his Talent's follow-up attack, provides all allies with a Fortified Wager that can block DMG equal to <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> of Aventurine's DEF plus <nobr>#2[i]</nobr>, and additionally grants a Fortified Wager that can block DMG equal to <nobr>#4[i]%</nobr> of Aventurine's DEF plus <nobr>#5[i]</nobr> to the ally with the lowest Shield effect, lasting for 3 turns.
embedBonusSkill.name: Bingo!

embedBonusSkill.descHash: For every <nobr>100</nobr> of Aventurine's DEF that exceeds <nobr>#3[i]</nobr>, increases his own CRIT Rate by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>, up to a maximum increase of <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr>.
embedBonusSkill.name: Leverage

embedBonusSkill.descHash: When battle starts, grants all allies a Fortified Wager shield, whose Shield effect is equal to <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr> of the one provided by the Skill, lasting for <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> turn(s).
embedBonusSkill.name: Hot Hand

voiceItems.title: First Meeting
voiceItems.text: Your humble servant "Aventurine," at your disposal. Just a cog in the machine known as the IPC's Strategic Investment Department. Nevertheless, I can also play the role of "friend" — if needed.

voiceItems.title: Greeting
voiceItems.text: How about a game? Nothing fancy, just a game of heads or tails to gauge today's luck.

voiceItems.title: Parting
voiceItems.text: Satisfied with our transaction, I trust? Cast your eyes to the future, and you'll realize we both stand to gain from a little mutual understanding.

voiceItems.title: About Self: Luck
voiceItems.text: How to win a whole planet with just one chip? Strategizing, scheming, calculating... but ultimately, it hinges on luck. Good luck makes one powerful, but destiny? Inherently unjust.

voiceItems.title: About Self: Trading Partners
voiceItems.text: I prefer the beggar over the rich man. The rich have no idea what they're after in life, but the beggar? Those folks — they know exactly what they want.

voiceItems.title: Chat: Interastral Peace Corporation
voiceItems.text: "Fortune" forms the foundation of our world. The flourishing of the cosmos relies on exchange and commerce — the IPC facilitates such connections between planets, weaving everything and everyone together. Wealth begets Erudition, produces Elation, averts Destruction, and builds Harmony.

voiceItems.title: Chat: Exploitation and Betrayal
voiceItems.text: Go ahead, use me as you wish, even stab me in the back if you see fit. Exploitation and treachery are simply tools of the trade. But remember, I don't make deals that don't pay off... So, I hope you don't disappoint me.

voiceItems.title: Hobbies
voiceItems.text: There's no denying it, my fascination is with the game of chance... be it the exhilarating rush of triumph or the extensive emptiness that follows, both are worth savoring, time and time again.

voiceItems.title: Annoyances
voiceItems.text: Life would be quite dull if it were just an unending series of wins, wouldn't it?

voiceItems.title: Something to Share
voiceItems.text: The heart of the IPC revolves around earnings and expansion. It can weather a loss here and there, but stagnation is impermissible. A daring gamble is better than being overly cautious — just like the wager Diamond made on me... We both deserve congratulations for that one.

voiceItems.title: Knowledge
voiceItems.text: The Watchmaker of Penacony doesn't primarily make their living from watchmaking, yet the place is a magnet for talented horologists. Look at this piece, for example. Its hands and face are imbued with memoria, artfully altering its appearance to reflect the wearer's emotions... As for me, I'd probably just prefer swapping out watches.

voiceItems.title: About Topaz
voiceItems.text: She's always searching for the optimal solution in maintaining equilibrium between the corporation and its customers. Not an easy feat if you ask me, but she's climbed the corporate ladder incredibly fast, so she must be doing something right.

voiceItems.title: About Dr. Ratio
voiceItems.text: The erudite folks of the Intelligentsia Guild are often eager to distance themselves from the IPC... and I suspect Ratio doesn't care for me much either. Unfortunately for him, I make for a more competent conversationalist than the other dimwits around here.

voiceItems.title: About Black Swan
voiceItems.text: Nothing remains hidden from a Memokeeper. If she's set her sights on you, it's clear she's after something. Consider how you might turn that to your advantage.

voiceItems.title: About Acheron
voiceItems.text: A chip of unknown value, a card of unknown suit, yet... it is she who will shape the entire course of the game.

voiceItems.title: About Sunday
voiceItems.text: Taking a shortcut or two isn't a big deal, but blatantly dipping your hands into someone else's pockets — that lacks finesse.

voiceItems.title: About Sparkle
voiceItems.text: The Fools never play to win — they're more like crazed thrill seekers.

voiceItems.title: Eidolon Activation
voiceItems.text: Give me a single die, and watch me turn the tables.

voiceItems.title: Character Ascension
voiceItems.text: That's all? It's settled then — I'm going all-in.

voiceItems.title: Max Level Reached
voiceItems.text: See? I knew I'd picked the right side.

voiceItems.title: Trace Activation
voiceItems.text: The game's not over yet. Let's raise the stakes, shall we?

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Trailblazer
voiceItems.text: Ah, Miss/Mr. Stellaron. Time for us to reveal our true value to one another.

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Topaz
voiceItems.text: Same project again? With you here, I've got nothing to worry about.

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Dr. Ratio
voiceItems.text: Well, look who it is. How about you give me a hand this time, Ratio?

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Black Swan
voiceItems.text: Lay out your plans, Memokeeper. I will find my place in the web of your schemes.

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Sparkle
voiceItems.text: Teetering on the precipice of danger is quite enchanting, wouldn't you agree?

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Acheron
voiceItems.text: Any justification here for you to unsheathe your blade... Emanator?

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Jade
voiceItems.text: Lady Jade herself has come? What's wrong? You don't trust me?

voiceItems.title: About Jade
voiceItems.text: Be careful, our lady's kindness always comes with a price. I've received it many times, so I'm already used to it.

voiceItems.title: Battle Begins: Weakness Break
voiceItems.text: Looks like I've got a winning hand.

voiceItems.title: Battle Begins: Danger Alert
voiceItems.text: High stakes, high rewards.

voiceItems.title: Turn Begins 1
voiceItems.text: Better hedge your bets.

voiceItems.title: Turn Begins 2
voiceItems.text: Alright, I'll call your bet~

voiceItems.title: Turn Idling
voiceItems.text: Opportunity doesn't knock on its own, you know.

voiceItems.title: Basic ATK
voiceItems.text: Can't lose this one.

voiceItems.title: Skill 1
voiceItems.text: Going all in. Tab's on me.

voiceItems.title: Skill 2
voiceItems.text: Don't ask. Just spend.

voiceItems.title: Hit by Light Attack
voiceItems.text: No dirty tricks, alright?

voiceItems.title: Hit by Heavy Attack
voiceItems.text: Trying to pull a fast one?

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Activate
voiceItems.text: The dice have been cast.

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Unleash
voiceItems.text: Bust? Or maybe I'll take it all!

voiceItems.title: Downed
voiceItems.text: Lost it all...

voiceItems.title: Return to Battle
voiceItems.text: Back in the game!

voiceItems.title: Health Recovery
voiceItems.text: Trust me, this is a guaranteed win.

voiceItems.title: Talent 1
voiceItems.text: Watch your head!

voiceItems.title: Talent 2
voiceItems.text: All in!

voiceItems.title: Technique
voiceItems.text: Feeling lucky?

voiceItems.title: Battle Won
voiceItems.text: As if victory were ever in doubt.

voiceItems.title: Treasure Opening 1
voiceItems.text: Heh, this is hardly enough for a seat at the table.

voiceItems.title: Treasure Opening 2
voiceItems.text: A reward with no risk? I'll take it.

voiceItems.title: Precious Treasure Opening
voiceItems.text: Fortune follows luck, just like it always does.

voiceItems.title: Successful Puzzle-Solving 1
voiceItems.text: An unsurprising win.

voiceItems.title: Successful Puzzle-Solving 2
voiceItems.text: A ten-to-one payout? Music to my ears.

voiceItems.title: Enemy Target Found
voiceItems.text: The bigger the risk, the better the reward...

voiceItems.title: Returning to Town
voiceItems.text: All this free time, why not make the most of it with a game?

storyItems.title: Character Details
storyItems.text:
Senior manager of the Strategic Investment Department at the IPC and one of the Ten Stonehearts. His Cornerstone is the "aventurine of stratagems."
An ostentatious risk-taker, he often wears a smile that masks his true motives.
He won his current position by wagering against fate itself. He views life as a high-stakes, high-return investment, and he plays this particular gamble with masterful ease.

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part I
storyItems.text:
"I have something to report to you about the new employee."

"What makes you so worried, Erwin?"

"It's complaints about him, both formal and informal. My mailbox has been flooded with them like countless pieces of paper. I wonder... if it's worth reconsidering his inclusion in the Strategic Investment Department."

"What do these complaints say?"

"Mostly about his origins. Those eyes of his..."
"He once deceived the Marketing Development Department by falsely claiming that there were energy sources hidden in the barren land of Sigonia, not yet effectively developed and utilized. A huge amount of funds was invested into excavating it before we realized it was all a scam."
"And then there's the notorious Egyhazo Aventurine Case. He misled the Intelligentsia Guild into believing that the remains of Tayzzyronth the Imperator Insectorum were buried there. Despite the scholars being extremely cautious, they ultimately still fell into the trap."
"And let's not forget the letters from the councilors of the Sigonian Sovereignty. They denounce his tribe for once breaking agreements and sowing discord, leading to significant changes in the balance of peace between the tribes, resulting in repeated delays in the signing of agreements between Sigonia and IPC. Allowing such an employee to join at the IPC would be a severe detriment to public relations..."

"If these are the extent of the complaints, there's no need to tell me."

"...You already know it all?"

"Each gemstone holds unique value, and our task is to make investments."
"We don't need to appease those stubborn old-timers who sent in complaints, as these rumors will eventually reach... No, they would already have reached his ears. Well, let's take this chance and see how big of a surprise he can bring us."

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part II
storyItems.text:
"You're quite something else, boy... I still can't figure out how you managed to empty out my entire business. But I will never surrender. If push comes to shove, I'll just blow up this whole place... What are you gonna do about it?"
The Mad Bull of Iymanika signals his followers to let go. He raises his head from the table, dusting off his collar.
"You arrogant dogs from the IPC never respected us wanderers, did you? But now that you're in our territory, you'll play by our rules."

Mad Bull empties the cylinder, putting only one bullet in the revolver, and tosses it to the other man's feet.
"Six shots. Fate will decide whether we live or die after a maximum of six shots. Do you have the nerve?"

The other man bends down and picks up the revolver.
"There are too many people who've pointed a gun at me. Some of them even just went ahead and pressed the trigger straight up... Now, guess how come I'm still standing here."
The man stands up, stares into the Mad Bull's eyes, raises the gun, and puts it against his own heart.
"It's because the gun will always end up in my hand."

"And now, this game is making me bored... One in six? That possibly is nowhere near enough. If you want to tempt fate..."
Six consecutive gunshots thunder out in the starship that is wrapped in a deathly silence. After the smoke clears, the man raises the gun again and walks toward Mad Bull. The revolver is now loaded with a fresh bullet.
"You need to learn how to turn yourself into a die first."
"...You won't surrender, but why? Because you have this lousy game of chance? Or..."
He points the gun into the darkness.
"Because of her?"

A woman holding a pistol emerges slowly from the direction the revolver points. The Mad Bull acts as if he found a lifeline when he sees her.
"Madam Jade, this is not what we agreed upon..."
At that moment, both of them opened fire simultaneously, and two figures dressed in black fall from the shadows behind each of them.

"The IPC has enemies everywhere, right?" The woman calmly holsters her pistol, takes out her cosmetic mirror, and inspects her appearance.
"You used our lives as bait, making them believe there was internal strife between us, and then you eliminated them all... A clever trick, although a bit reckless." He greets the woman with a smile, although his hands tremble slightly.

"Trick? No, it was just a test."
The elegant lady opens her palm, revealing a shimmering aventurine of peculiar hues.
"There's nothing strange about it. Gemstones are destined to be... desired, sought, cut, and sold."
"However, there's so much more you can do. It all depends on how you see yourself."

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part III
storyItems.text:
He walks into the room at the furthest end of the corridor, remembering how he was still a grotesque prisoner the last time he came here. Now, he stands with his back straight and faces those who sit at the very top of the department.

He listens to the blond woman as she reads out the lengthy and boring report. Those cold, unfeeling numbers cannot convey the dangers that accompanied him as he walked on the thin line between life and death, nor can they communicate how much he had lost and gained during the journey. He is simply curious whether she is human or an Intellitron.

The aventurine, that symbol of power and of the future, is about to be officially handed to him — Yet it would have no more allure or value in his eyes as soon he obtains it, even though he had sought it by putting his life on the line.

"Do you have any more questions, Aventurine?" Jade, the only person he knows among the presently gathered, asks at the end of the meeting.

"The Avgins in Sigonia... what happened to them afterward?"

"Unfortunately, there are no more Avgins in Sigonia. You're the last lucky dog."

"What about those people who helped me on planet ██? Now I can finally repay their kindness."

"They are no more, either."

...

He returns to his office in a daze. The aventurine stone emits a peculiar glow on his desk, seemingly congratulating and mocking him at the same time.
"Was luck truly on your side when you wrestled with fate?"

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part IV
storyItems.text:
"Penacony... Is Diamond finally ready to do something about it?"
The miniature model on the table continues to rotate, the crystalline memory bubble emitting tiny spheres of foam.

"This historic debt is utterly unimaginable. So, the profit involved is also... shockingly high."
The person in front of him has their back turned to him, gazing instead at the purplish-red sky of Pier Point at sunset.

"But why me?"
The person continues to face away from him. Keen though his eyes are, he can not decipher the true intentions behind the decision.

"It should have been me, but Diamond believes that The Family still had some value in cooperation and hopes this affair still has some room for a peaceful resolution."
"So, after some thought, I've concluded that you're the best candidate."

"This is only our second conversation ever. Do you trust me that much?"

"No, I've never trusted you. Perhaps Jade does, but I don't."
"Maybe luck won't be on your side this time, and the bill for all your past good fortune will come due."

Finally, the person in front of him turns around. The distant skyscraper reflects a kaleidoscope of colors like an opal stone, while a music box plays on its own.
"But isn't that what you've been longing for?"

name: Aventurine
descHash: A high-ranking executive of the IPC's Strategic Investment Department. A risk-taker, his constant smile makes it difficult for people to discern his true feelings.
